title: Buy Huhtamaki PPL Ltd (HPPL) - Target 280
text:
Huhtamaki PPL Ltd (HPPL) is a leading consumer packaging company is known for its pioneering efforts in flexible packaging since 1935.Huhtamaki PPL Ltd (HPPL) is India’s leading manufacturer of primary consumer packaging and labeling materials with annual consolidated Euro 300 million. It is the largest manufacturer in volume of finished flexible packaging in the larger Africa - India - Asia Pacific region excluding Japan.

HPPL has 14 manufacturing facilities in India, located in Thane (Maharashtra), Silvassa (Dadra and Nagar Haveli), Hyderabad, Rudrapur (Uttarakhand), Parwanoo, Khopoli, Taloja, Ambernath, Bengaluru and Guwahati. HPPL has a total installed capacity of 1,53,981 tons per annum and approximate capacity utilization in the range of 75%. Huhtamaki already has 10 manufacturing units internaltionally and the management is thriving to develop International business to a greater extent.

HPPL offers a wide portfolio of packaging solutions that include flexible packaging, including a variety of pouching solutions, labeling technologies, shrink sleeve solutions, specialized cartons, packaging machines, tube laminates, promotional, holographic and security solutions, cylinders and specialized films for a high barrier. The proverbial ”One Stop Shop” in a true sense.

The Company has an impressive client list that includes Britannia, Coca Cola, Ferrero, Glaxo Smithkline, Marico (NS: ), Mondelez (NASDAQ:NASDAQ: ), Nestle, Pepsico (NASDAQ:NASDAQ: ), P&G, Unilever (LON:LON: ), etc

Huhtamaki-PPL Q2 2019 Quarterly Results have been muted compared to the previous quarter (Q1 2019 ) but the company performed well compared to Q2 2018.

Net Sales at Rs 633.75 crore in June 2019 up 6.43% from Rs. 595.48 crore in June 2018.

Quarterly Net Profit at Rs. 27.93 crore in June 2019 up 96% from Rs. 14.25 crore in June 2018.

EBITDA stands at Rs. 74.36 crore in June 2019 up 37.14% from Rs. 54.22 crore in June 2018.

Huhtamaki PPL EPS has increased to Rs. 3.70 in June 2019 from Rs. 1.89 in June 2018.

Year on year comaprison of financial performance

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced several fiscal measures on September 20, 2019, to boost the economy. The Finance Minister announced a cut in the corporate tax rate for domestic companies and new domestic manufacturing companies. The tax rate will be 22 percent without exemptions, effective corporate tax rate after surcharge to be 25.17 percent.

The given policy change is to help Huhtamaki PPL Ltd exponentially. The company has faced pressure on Net Margins due to high tax outflows.

We expect Huhtamaki-PPL to perform well due to the recent possitive reforms by the goverment.

Companies is to benifit from its strong FMGC customer base and reduction of taxes.

Rupee has depreciated lately, which is likely to support HPPL’s margins.

Huhtamaki-PPL is quoting at 233 in NSE as on 20 Sept 2019 we recommend a buy with a target of 280 by 1-year time horizon.
